definition: Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]
branch of study/administrative section/division/field/branch/stage directions/family (taxonomy)/rules/laws/to mete out (punishment)/to levy (taxes etc)/to fine sb/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: The boys and girls danced to the disco music.
sentences.chinese: 少男少女們跟着迪斯科音樂跳舞。

sentences.english: I have bought him books and computer discos.
sentences.chinese: 我給他買的書和電腦迪斯科舞廳。

sentences.english: Disco Purge Method can be obtained via your DuPont Sales Representative.
sentences.chinese: 迪斯科吹掃方法可透過您的杜邦公司的銷售代表。

sentences.english: The young girls and boys boogied all night long.
sentences.chinese: 那些少男少女跳了個通宵的迪斯科舞。

sentences.english: The disco ball over the rink sprinkled dizzying light through her long-again hair.
sentences.chinese: 在冰場的迪斯科球灑通過她的長頭髮又令人眩目的光。

sentences.english: If I learned how to disco and cha - cha.
sentences.chinese: 如果我能學會跳迪斯科和恰恰。

sentences.english: Rock disco hair should be preferred if you have thick hair.
sentences.chinese: 如果你的頭髮比較厚，搖滾迪斯科頭會更好。

sentences.english: Amateur talent activities and disco in the evening.
sentences.chinese: 晚上是業餘才藝表演和迪斯科舞。

sentences.english: Let's invite her to the disco — she needs distraction.
sentences.chinese: 我們請她去迪斯科舞會吧，她需要散散心。

sentences.english: There are quite a few of night clubs and discos around Jiuyanqiao Bridge.
sentences.chinese: 在九眼橋附近有許多夜總會和迪斯科廳。
這種迪斯科舞會吸引着年輕人。

sentences.english: I've booked the discotheque for the party.
sentences.chinese: 我爲聚會安排了迪斯科舞廳。

sentences.english: I like listening to pop music and going to discos .
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡聽流行音樂，上迪斯科舞廳。

sentences.english: He started going to discotheques in his early youth.
sentences.chinese: 他少年時就開始去迪斯科舞廳。

sentences.english: The disco was a confusion of loud noises. ;
sentences.chinese: 迪斯科舞廳一片混亂的喧吵的噪音。

definition: disco/night club/abbr. for 迪斯科廳|迪斯科厅
